Description.val: This line item funds modifications to all in-service aircraft engines.  Power Plant Changes (PPC) are required throughout the service life of each aircraft to correct flight deficiencies and improve operational readiness while reducing engine operating costs.  This program finances the procurement and installation of retrofit kits for all Navy and Marine Corp aircraft engines and related propulsion hardware such as propellers, starters and transmissions .  The overall goal of the modifications budgeted in FY 2019 is to continue modification efforts previously  initiated on the engines for the AV-8B, F/A-18C/D & E/F, EA-18G, F-16, H-60, H-53, EA-6B, T-3, T-45, P-3, P-8A, E-2C, E-2D, C-2A, C-130, UH-1Y, AH-1Z, AH-1W, JSF, H-53 and V-22.

Justification.val: FY 2019 funding for procurement and installation of retrofit kits for all Navy and Marine Corp aircraft engines and related propulsion hardware.  The FY 2019 funding request was reduced by $0.464M to reflect the Department of Navy's effort to support the Office of Management and Budget directed reforms for Efficiency and Effectiveness that include a lean, accountable, more efficient government.

Name.@footnote: Unit cost growth in FY18/FY19 is due to expensive Bearing Housing and Oil Drains tank redesign kits for ECP 3926.
F404 decrease between FY19/FY20 due to expected quantity decrease of After Burner Flame Holder kits.
Unit cost growth in FY17/FY18/FY19/FY20/FY23 due to kit and quantity increase for C29 Pilot Spray Bar upgrades.

Unit Cost growth in FY17/FY18/FY19 due to additional kit requirements and expensive attachment kits for NP2000 Propeller Feather System Upgrade. Decrease from FY20/FY21 due to expected quantity decrease of NP2000 Propeller Feather System kits.
Name.val: 1.1.6) T56 P3, C2, E2, C130 - NonOrganic

Name.@footnote: Because of an emergent requirement with Nacelle Blower Improvements Ceramic Bearing upgrade for the MV-22 and CV-22, retrofit kits were required to start in FY17 instead of FY19 to extend service life. Increase between FY18/FY19 is due to quantity increase for the Nacelle Blower Improvements Ceramic Bearing upgrade kits.

The CH-53K will be IOC beginning in 2020.  RDTE CIP investments will begin in 2018 we expect that design changes will result in the requirement for retrofit kits around 2021. Based on this, CH-53K has been added to the requirements list and future requirements are reflected in the FYDP.

Name.val: 1.1.11) Completed ECPs from prior years - NonOrganic

Name.@footnote: Admin and Production Leadtimes are averages with various contract and delivery dates

ImplementationMethodName.val: See Notes:: Installation Name: Power Plant Installations

Description.val: This program corrects aircraft flight safety deficiencies, improves operational fleet readiness, and reduces engine total cost of ownership by incorporating approved power plant changes.  Power plant changes are required throughout the aircraft service life as the engine ages and operationally revealed deficiencies are discovered, researched, and solutions engineered.  Propulsion and Power (P&P) Component Improvement Program (CIP), which is funded in Research Development Test & Evaluation, Navy develops and demonstrates engineering solutions to these deficiencies and through the Engineering Change Proposal (ECP) process, initiates Power Plant Change.  The Power Plant Change program procures the necessary retrofit kits, support equipment, kit installation and technical data.  This program provides retrofit kits for all Navy and Marine Corp aircraft engines and propulsion related hardware such as propellers, starters, generators and transmissions.  Reliability Improvements are designed to increase Mean Time Between Failure and Mean Time Between Engine Removal by 30% on average and are expected to generate savings /costs avoidance in excess of $50M annually.  Aircraft engines included in Power Plant Change include: F402 Engine AV/8B, F404 Engine F/A18, F414 Engine F/A 18 E/F and EA-18G, J52, T400 Engine AH-1W and UH-1N, AE1107 Engine V-22, T56 Engine P-3, C-2, E-2D and C130, T-64 Engine H-53, T700 Engine H-60 and AH-1, CFM56-7B Engine P8A T408 Engine H-53K, T406 Engine V-22.
